definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
(of one person) to hold the successive posts of/(of several persons) the successive (presidents etc)

sentences.english: It shows how a strong friendship can last through the worst possible times.
sentences.chinese: 這說明一份真摯的友誼可以歷苦難而彌堅。

sentences.english: It's a calendar with all the community events on it.
sentences.chinese: 是一本臺歷，上面列出了所有的社區活動。

sentences.english: Hill with thick, which has the final calendar vicissitudes.
sentences.chinese: 山以其厚重，歷滄桑而爲之雄渾。

sentences.english: Lucky for us we only need to work with three of these calendars.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，我們只需要計算其中三種歷。

sentences.english: Odor Sim and , also uses a wide side of the border material, the calendar as a tribute.
sentences.chinese: 氣味辛和，用途亦廣，本境方物，歷爲貢品”。

sentences.english: The ship has missed for six months, or no more can it be salvaged for repair after sinking.
sentences.chinese: 船舶失蹤歷六個月或沈沒不能打撈修復時。

sentences.english: Legia played a game with good commitment.
sentences.chinese: 歷基亞隊很好的投入到比賽當中去。

sentences.english: From Jin, Yuan to Ming and Qing dynasties, Dongyue Temples were set all around.
sentences.chinese: 歷金元至明清，各府州縣已普遍建立起東嶽廟。

sentences.english: This means Phaedra may pursue her passion for Hippolytus and offer him the crown of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 所以她可大膽追求希波歷踶並賜給他皇冠。
